                                 Release Notes
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
BBC Four TimeShift documentary examining how the British were poised to excel 
in space science engineering in the post war period -  only to be subjected to 
funding cuts and a &#039;brain-drain&#039; to other countries.

Gives a rare view of the immediate history of rocket development following the 
shock of Von Braun&#039;s V2 which created an early shock &#039;n&#039; awe over an unaware 
London in 1944. The British role in chasing Nazi scientists and subsequent 
technology transfer of rocketry goodies to the UK. On a limited budget, playing 
second fiddle to the USA -  British engineers achieved amazing things in the 
decades following WWII.
